description: This notification is generated when device receives an NA packet,which
source Ipv6 address is the same as Ipv6 address of the device.

event.Summary: IPv6 address conflict detected for device

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-IPV6-MIB::hwDadIPv6ConflictTrap HUAWEI-VLAN-MIB::hwVlanID i 9999 HUAWEI-IPV6-MIB::hwIpv6LinklocalAddr s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEX HUAWEI-IPV6-MIB::hwIpv6GlobalAddrAddress s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEX IPV6-MIB::ipv6NetToMediaPhysAddress s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwOntIndex i 9999

description: Indicates the corresponding VLAN ID of a VLAN interface.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VLAN-MIB::hwVlanID

description: This object specifies the link local address on the interface.
For creation of auto link local address, this object value must be ignored.
variables.name: HUAWEI-IPV6-MIB::hwIpv6LinklocalAddr

description: This object specifies the global or EUI IPv6 address on the interface.
variables.name: HUAWEI-IPV6-MIB::hwIpv6GlobalAddrAddress

description: The index of a shelf in the device.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: A slot index is used to identify the location of a board in a shelf.
You can locate a board in a shelf according to hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.
For the hwFrameIndex object, refer to hwFrameTable.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, indicating the physical number of the port on a board.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: Parameters hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex are obligatory, hwOntIndex and hwPortIndex are optional
(the setting -1 indicates that the parameter is optional).
For example, to set the information of all ONTs connected to a specified port returned
you can set hwOntIndex to -1; to set the information about the status of all ONTs
connected to all ports of a specified slot returned, you can set hwPortIndex and hwOntIndex to -1
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwOntIndex
